intro: Neillia affinis var. longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled neillia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with elongated sepals that give it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
